title: Multi-source Oracle Aggregation
summary: Cardano has many price sources, but no unified feed. This causes DeFi apps to show inconsistent token prices, leading to errors in interest, liquidation, or user display
solution: We build an Multi-source Oracle Aggregation, that combines prices from Orcfax, Liqwid, DEX pools, etc., to provide a unified, reliable price feed for DeFi apps across the Cardano ecosystem.
proposer_relevant_experience:
1. Truong Quang Chu (Smart Contract Engineer): 5+ years of experience in Plutus, Aiken, and system integration, specializing in Cardano smart contract development
    1. [https://github\.com/tqchu](https://github.com/tqchu)
2. Nguyen Thi Kim Chi (Backend Engineer): 5++ years of experience in backend systems, micro-service application and and integration, specializing in Cardano
    1. www.linkedin.com/in/chi-nguyen-773871288

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Cardano has many Oracle Sources like Orcfax, Chaili3, Liqwid, Indigo, and DEX pools. But there is no unified system to combine these prices. 



Each dApp chooses its own source, leading to inconsistent token prices, unfair liquidations, and inaccurate interest calculations.

A GitHub repository containing smart contracts deployed on testnet.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Cardano has many Oracle Sources like Orcfax, Chaili3, Liqwid, Indigo, and DEX pools. But there is no unified system to combine these prices. Each dApp chooses its own source, leading to inconsistent token prices, unfair liquidations, and inaccurate interest calculations.



Approach:

- Build a Multi-Source Oracle Aggregation system that collects token prices from multiple Oracle Sources.
- Each token price can be calculated through multiple Oracle price paths (e.g., ADA → MIN → DJED).
- If any Oracle price path for a token pair differs more than 5% from the average, we exclude that pair from the final price feed.
- Publish final aggregated prices on-chain



Major Features:

- Aggregate prices from Orcfax, Liqwid, Indigo, DJED, and DEXs like Minswap.
- Open-source smart contracts and pricing logic.
- New Oracle Sources and price paths can be added easily
- Built-in safeguard: If any path gives abnormal data, it is automatically excluded



Audience

This project serves DeFi developers, lending protocols, and Cardano users who need reliable token prices. It helps projects build safer lending, collateral, and liquidation systems. Users benefit from fairer, more transparent DeFi experiences.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
impact outputs:

- Provide DeFi developers and projects on Cardano with accurate, real-time token prices aggregated from multiple Oracle Sources.
- Lower technical barriers for small and medium-sized projects by giving them a ready-to-use price feed.
- More DeFi protocols and encourage existing ones to migrate to a unified, secure price feed.
- Build trust in Cardano DeFi through open-source smart contracts and transparent price calculation.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Team Capability

- Our team has deep expertise in Cardano DeFi development, with proven experience across
- Smart Contracts Development: Extensive knowledge in Plutus and Aiken, with multiple deployments on testnet and mainnet.
- Off-chain Infrastructure: Strong skills in building reliable off-chain code, indexers, and backend services to support on-chain logic.
- Oracle & Data Integration: Practical experience integrating external price feeds and building aggregation logic for accuracy and resilience.



Technical Feasibility:



The Multi-Source Oracle Aggregation will be built using established Cardano development practices. The system will:

- Aggregate token prices from Multi-Source Oracle: Orcfax, Liqwid, Indigo, DEX pools as MinSwap, Splash
- Support multiple Oracle price paths and automatic filtering of unreliable ones
- Publish prices on-chain, easy integration

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Estimated Project Duration: 8 months – Total Budget: ₳158,000 (ADA/USD ≈ 0.4, updated 26 Nov 2025)



1/ Product Research (₳23,000)

- Research Oracle Sources: Orcfax, Liqwid, Indigo, MinSwap, Splash. Define data flow, system architecture.

2/ Project Management (₳20,000)

- Coordinate tasks, track milestones, maintain Catalyst reports, manage resources.

3/ Project Development (₳85,000)

- Build backend aggregator, smart contracts, UI, integrate all Oracle Sources as per milestones.

4/ Project Testing (₳30,000)

- Functional tests, deploy on testnet and mainnet, and prepare final reports and documentation.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
This project builds Multi-Source Oracle Aggregator, giving Cardano developers a reliable and unified token price feed from multiple sources (Orcfax, Liqwid, Indigo, MinSwap, Splash).



₳158,000 budget is split across research, development, management, testing, matching the workload and market rates for blockchain development.



All outputs: smart contracts, UI, and documentation will be open-source from day one (github), ensuring reuse and reducing costs for future Cardano projects.



Impact is measurable through the number of sources integrated, token pairs supported. This ensures the budget delivers long-term value and practical benefits to the ecosystem.
